definition: to shake/to vibrate/to jolt/to quake/excited/shocked/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing thunder/☳

sentences.english: In Wenchuan Earthquake, Xi'an city and Baoji city in Shaanxi Province are in areas with large epicentral distance.
sentences.chinese: 汶川地震中，陝西省西安市和寶雞市兩地處於遠震區。

sentences.english: Teams like these were making tough choices all across the earthquake zone.
sentences.chinese: 震區的所有救援隊伍都面臨着艱難的抉擇。

sentences.english: China sent a 50-member rescue team to Haiti and they will set off on Wednesday.
sentences.chinese: 中國已經派出一支50人的救援小組前往海地震區。

sentences.english: Rain forecast for quake-hit areas on next 2 days.
sentences.chinese: 未來兩天震區的雨天氣預報。

sentences.english: The China Youth Travel Service offers day-trips to the quake zone.
sentences.chinese: 中國青年旅行社也提供震區一日遊服務。

sentences.english: About 60 rescuers from the CEA left Beijing for Qinghai this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 中國地震救援隊60人今天下午從北京飛往震區。

sentences.english: In thses two days , people were moved to tears for nearly each news reported in the earthquake areas.
sentences.chinese: 這兩天，幾乎每一條關於震區的新聞都讓人落淚。

sentences.english: But there were obvious tensions in the earthquake zone.
sentences.chinese: 但是，震區很顯然存在着緊張氣氛。

sentences.english: China Centers for Disease Control and Prevention already had delivered 10000 plague prevention leaflets to the quake zone.
sentences.chinese: 中國疾控中心已經往震區運了1萬份疫情防控宣傳單。

sentences.english: Repeated levelling surveys have been made at the seismic areas before and after the earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 在該震區地震前後做了一些大地測量的複測工作。
